title: Nick Reiner Talked Openly About His Struggles
summary: He and his father, the director Rob Reiner, also worked together on a film that was loosely inspired by the son’s early life.

title: Rob Reiner and Wife Found Stabbed to Death: What We Know
summary: The director’s family said that he and his wife, Michele, died on Sunday, and county jail records show that their son, Nick Reiner, was arrested.

title: Gunshots at Brown University, Then 12 Hours of Lockdown and Fear
summary: Students sheltered in place in classrooms and basements, waiting for the all clear.

title: U.S. Soldiers Killed in Syria Identified as Iowa National Guard Sergeants
summary: The shooting attack in Palmyra, Syria, on Saturday struck troops deployed as part of an antiterrorism mission. Two were killed, along with an American civilian interpreter; three others were wounded.

title: How the Bondi Beach Shooting Unfolded at a Hanukkah Celebration
summary: Two men toting long guns opened fire on hundreds of people who were celebrating Hanukkah on Bondi Beach in Sydney, the core of the Australian city’s Jewish community.

title: Ahmed el Ahmed, Who Tackled One of the Bondi Beach Gunmen, Is Recovering in a Hospital
summary: Video of Ahmed el Ahmed disarming one of the gunmen has gone viral, and officials around the world have hailed his bravery.

title: What to Know About the Victims of the Bondi Beach Shooting
summary: At least 15 people were killed in the attack in Sydney, Australia, including a 10-year-old girl, a long-serving rabbi and a Holocaust survivor.

title: Olivia Dean, Josh Johnson and Chase Infiniti Are Among Our 2025 Breakout Stars
summary: Across the arts, these 10 performers took a leap of faith this year and stuck the landing in a big way.

title: A Powerful New Drug Is Creating a ‘Withdrawal Crisis’ in Philadelphia
summary: Medetomidine, a veterinary sedative, mixed into fentanyl has sent thousands to hospitals, not only for overdose but for life-threatening withdrawal. It is spreading to other cities.

title: He Tried to Protect His Son From Bullies. He Didn’t Know How Far They Would Go.
summary: After his son was repeatedly attacked, Rick Kuehner reached out to his suburban school, to the police and to other parents. The violence only got worse.

title: U.K. Spy Chief Warns of Growing Russia Threat in Europe
summary: In her first public speech as head of MI6, Blaise Metreweli said Russia was attempting to export chaos to Europe through hybrid attacks and disinformation.

title: The Turbulent Times of Friedrich Merz
summary: The new chancellor believes the world needs a stronger Germany. He is still navigating how to do it.

title: Zelensky Meets U.S. Envoys in Berlin in New Round of Ukraine Peace Talks
summary: For the second day running, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine met in Berlin with American diplomats, seeking to bridge divides over how to end the war.

title: Trump’s Cuts Hobbled US Labor Board, Leaving Festering Disputes and a Power Struggle
summary: Advocates fear damage to labor protections if the Supreme Court upholds the president’s move to control federal agency staffing.

title: Trump’s Diversity Rollback Ends Crucial Aid for Deafblind Children Like Annie Garner
summary: A program for deafblind children helped 3-year-old Annie Garner, born with poor vision and no ears, learn to communicate. The Trump administration cut the program’s funding over diversity goals.

title: Trial to Start for Judge Accused of Helping Undocumented Immigrant Evade Agents
summary: The Milwaukee County judge faces federal charges, but she has maintained her innocence.

title: How Tech’s Biggest Companies Are Offloading the Risks of the A.I. Boom
summary: The data centers used for work on artificial intelligence can cost tens of billions to build. Tech giants are finding ways to avoid being on the hook for some of those costs.

title: In A.I. Boom, Venture Capital Firms Are Raising Loads More Money
summary: Lightspeed Venture Partners, a Silicon Valley venture firm, has amassed more than $9 billion to invest in artificial intelligence. That is its biggest haul.

title: With Prices Soaring, Can New York Survive as a Mecca for the Arts?
summary: The number of artists living in the city has declined after growing sharply between 2004 and 2019. Almost 50 arts venues have closed in the past five years.

title: Trump’s Diplomats Act More Like Cowboys. Could That Be a Good Thing?
summary: Sometimes Trump’s unconventional foreign policy just works.

title: Bret Stephens on the Fight for the Future of the Right
summary: The columnist believes America’s real political contest is in the center.

title: An Update on Two Shootings
summary: We have the latest from Brown University and Bondi Beach.

title: U.S. Military Plane and JetBlue Flight Nearly Collided Over Caribbean, Radio Traffic Shows
summary: The Air Force refueling tanker was flying without its location transponder activated and could not be detected by air traffic control.

title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement
summary: José Antonio Kast, who was elected president on Sunday, is the latest conservative to rise to power promising strict law and order measures.

title: Hong Kong Media Tycoon Jimmy Lai’s Conviction Was Years in the Making
summary: Jimmy Lai spent decades criticizing China’s rulers. He faces up to life in prison after a court found him guilty of national security crimes.

title: ‘Don’t Feed the Pig’: The Anti-Corruption Call That Helped Topple a Government
summary: Mass demonstrations in Bulgaria were spurred by spreading outrage over graft that many say was fueling an authoritarian power grab.
